FuncDef:
The access-speed adjustment edsg-queue enable command enables a device to preferentially allocate CPU resources to users who request to go online and temporarily delay the activation of EDSG services that enter the activation queue.
The undo access-speed adjustment edsg-queue enable command disables this function.
By default, a device is not enabled to preferentially allocate CPU resources to users who request to go online, and EDSG services and access users enjoy the same priority in CPU resource allocation.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In scenarios where a large number of users request to go online and the system CPU usage is running high, run the access-speed adjustment edsg-queue enable command to enable a device to preferentially allocate CPU resources to users who request to go online and temporarily delay the activation of EDSG services that enter the activation queue.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
